instruction: Interpret the significance of the given quote.
input: "A life without purpose is a languid, drifting thing; every day we ought to review our purpose, saying to ourselves, This day let me make a sound beginning, for what we have hitherto done is naught!"
output: The quote emphasizes the importance of having a purpose in life. It encourages us to set goals every day and strive to make meaningful progress towards them. It also acknowledges that our past efforts, no matter how small or inconsequential they may seem, are still of importance and should not be discounted.
